description: If the system configuration is changed
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgManEventlog HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogSrcCmd i 1 HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogSrcData i 1 HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogDesData i 1 HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogTerminalUser s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogCmdSrcAddress a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogConfigChangeId u 0 HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogTime t 31536000 HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogCfgBaselineTime s EXAMPLE

description: Specifies the source command resulting in the log.
Currently we provide the types of source:
3.other(3):configuration log instigated by other source unknown.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogSrcCmd

description: The configuration data source for the event.
startup what the system will use next reboot
hotPlugging board is inserted or pulled out on line
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogSrcData

description: The configuration data destination for the event.
startup what the system will use next reboot
hotPlugging board is inserted or pulled out on line
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogDesData

description: The name of a logging user which is available when hwCfgLogSrcCmd
is 'cmdLine'. When hwCfgLogTerminalType is 'virtual' and user login
in authentication, the object will be the name of the user.
Otherwise, it is a zero length string.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogTerminalUser

description: The address from which a request comes when the value of hwCfgLogSrcCmd is 'snmp(2)'.
The ip address of the remote system connected when the value of hwCfgLogTerminalType
Otherwise, the value of the object is 0.0.0.0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogCmdSrcAddress

description: This is the sequence ID of configuration. When configuration is changed, ID is added.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogConfigChangeId

description: Specifies the sysUpTime when the configuration log was generated.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogTime

description: Specifies the time of system confiuration was baseline.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgLogCfgBaselineTime

description: When a configuration operation has been done, a
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgOperateCompletion HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgOperateType i 1 HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgOperateTime t 31536000 HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgOperateState i 1 HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgOperateEndTime t 31536000

description: Specifies the type of an operation on configuration.
For detailed information, please see the ConfigOperationType
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgOperateType

description: Records the time taken for the operation. This object will
be like a stopwatch, starting when the operation
starts, and stopping when the operation completes.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgOperateTime

description: The status of the specified operation.
specified device is in use and locked by
device read, write or erase error
device is read-only but a write or erase
invalid file name; file not found in partition
file transfer was unsuccessfull; network failure
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgOperateState

description: The value of sysUpTime when the configuration operation is finished.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgOperateEndTime

description: that configurations of the AMB and the SMB are inconsistent,

event.Summary: Configurations of the AMB and SMB are inconsistent

description: that configurations of the AMB and the SMB change

event.Summary: Configurations of the AMB and SMB are consistent

description: When the system failed to backup current configuration to
specified server, this trap will generate to indicates the

event.Summary: Configuration backup ($v1) to server ($v2) is failed

description: The unique index value of a row in this table.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgBackupIndex

description: The ip address of the FTP/TFTP/SFTP server to
which to the device backup configuration automatically.
Values of 0.0.0.0 or FF.FF.FF.FF are not permitted.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgBackupServerIp

description: The protocol used to backup configuration to server automatically.
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgBackupProtocol

description: When the system begin to backup current configuration to

event.Summary: System started backing up the current configuration to servers

description: When configuration restoration fails, this trap is generated.

ErrorCode: cause of an alarm.(1:Failed to restore some configurations. 2:Failed to restore all configurations because of a failure to open the configuration file. 3:Failed to restore all configurations because of the nonexistent configuration file. 4:Failed to restore all configurations because of the nonexistent configuration file. 5: Failed to restore all configurations because of other reasons.)
variables.name: HUAWEI-CONFIG-MAN-MIB::hwCfgRestoreErrCode

description: When system automatically detects that configurations of the main board and the slave board are inconsistent, this trap is generated.

event.Summary: Mismatch in configurations of main and slave boards

description: When system automatically detects that configurations of the main board and the slave board change from inconsistent to consistent, this trap is generated.

event.Summary: Main board and slave board configurations are consistent

description: that configurations of the application and the Master Main Board are inconsistent,

event.Summary: Configuration mismatch between application and master main board

description: that configurations of the application and the Master Main Board change

event.Summary: Application and master main board configurations are consistent
